articles.summary: Emperor penguins serve as early-warning sentinels for the Antarctic ecosystem and climate change. For every one degree Celsius rise in temperature, emperor penguins shift their breeding site 73 meters further, while each additional centimeter of snowfall adds another 66 meters to the move. Researchers from Sun Yat-sen University and the University of Montana developed guano indices to map emperor penguin breeding habitats.

articles.title: Two from Congress say climate change hitting homeowners insurance, mortgages
articles.author: Watauga Democrat
articles.summary: Two members of Congress from North Carolina and Rhode Island say climate change is impacting rising insurance rates and access to mortgages, and it's also affecting access to the Internet.    .   "The Center Square" is published by The Center Square, a news agency.

articles.title: Northland Nature: Birds are not the only animals that migrate in the fall
articles.author: Duluth News Tribune
articles.summary: This time of the year is well known for the migration of birds. The birds are moving from one place to another to cope with the coming cold. The annual leaf drop from deciduous trees happens at about the middle of October, which is hard not to notice.

articles.title: Shelter in Cabo Delgado, Mozambique: 'We're going to build this together' (CARE International UK)
articles.author: Public Technologies
articles.summary: Cabo Delgado is the northernmost province of Mozambique. Since 2017, it has suffered the impact of a deadly insurrection fuelled by poverty. The seven-year insurgency has claimed more than 4,000 lives, around half of them civilians. Over 609,000 people live in Cabo Delgado.

articles.title: Earth from Space: Chilean glaciers
articles.author: system
articles.summary: The changing face of the Chilean glaciers in the Laguna San Rafael National Park is featured in satellite images from 1987 and 2024. The glaciers are visible in these satellite images taken from 1987 to 2024. They can be seen in the images from LagunaSanRafael National Park.

articles.title: Input sought on Cape Fear hazard mitigation plan
articles.author: THE SANFORD HERALD
articles.summary: Chatham County Emergency Management is working with regional partners to update the Cape Fear Regional Hazard Mitigation Plan. The plan identifies long-term strategies to reduce risks and losses from natural disasters. Chatham County is seeking input from residents to help shape how the county prepares for and responds to future hazards.
